Player History

Drove in 7 runs against California on 7/19/1967...
Had 2000th career hit on 5/19/1969, off Don Loun (TEX)...
Signed as a free agent by Texas on 2/1/1970 to a 1-year deal worth $6,000,000 per year...
Was selected to the 1970 Allstar game...
Drafted in 1st round, 15th overall pick, by Cleveland in 1972...
Injured on 8/18/1973 with a Broken Cheekbone, out for 8-9 weeks...

Injured on 6/16/1977 with a Sore Elbow, out for one week...
Earned first career win on 7/21/1977...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/25/1978, winning 2 games with a 0.00 ERA...

Injured on 4/16/1980 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 4 weeks...

Won World Series with New York (N) in 1985...
